channel.title: Putting the .JAR file into the HTML
channel.description:
I have my .JAR file, i used the JAR maker to make it, now i have uploaded it to DROPBOX....
So i have my JAR file. How would i code this into my HTML so when they click on the link it will take them to the webclient.... Also will i have to use another way of running the server through a different IP, if so how would i change the ip in which the client connects to?

item.title: Putting the .JAR file into the HTML
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Search client.java, launcher.java, gui.java, egui.java, and very rarely server.java

Read full topic
item.source: Putting the .JAR file into the HTML

item.title: Putting the .JAR file into the HTML
item.dc:creator: @cfsnipa cfsnipa
item.description:
@cfsnipa wrote:

I have went through multiple dozens and went through all my files to find the ip of which i would change to get the ip to connet to my server… If i can’t find it what would i do???
Im using Ic3d PK V1

Read full topic
item.source: Putting the .JAR file into the HTML

item.title: Putting the .JAR file into the HTML
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

You need to change the IP on the client, re-jar it, and re upload. To like to a webclient page you can do this:

As for the actual code, just look at a webclient tutorial.

Read full topic
